answers.Answer:
Redbox On Demand is a way to watch thousands of movies and TV shows without visiting the Box. You can stream or download directly from your tablet, phone, computer, Roku device, or select Smart TV. Find out how it works and get device registration steps at https://www.redbox.com/ondemand-howitworks.

There are two ways to access On Demand:

1. Computer - access your Redbox account and sign in: https://www.redbox.com/register
2. Tablet, Phone, Roku, Smart TV - download the Redbox app in applicable app store and sign in with the same credentials as your online account.

If you rent On Demand, you’ll have 30 days to start watching. Once you start watching, you'll have 48 hours to finish.

The amount of time left in your rental period is listed on the movie’s detail page, in your https://www.redbox.com/library, and in the Redbox app on iOS and Android.
Parental control options are not available for On Demand. However, we’re always adding new features and capabilities, so be on the lookout for any updates in the future.

We accept the following forms of payment for rentals and purchases:

At the Box

1. Debit Cards
2. Credit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover
3. Redbox Cards
4. MasterPass https://masterpass.com/en-us.html


On Demand

1. Debit Cards
2. Credit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, or Discover


E-Gift Cards and Promo Codes

1. Credit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, or Discover

To install and launch On Demand on your device, visit https://www.redbox.com/howitworks and scroll down to the Setting Up Your Device section. Select the device you want to use and instructions will appear just below it.
The MPAA is a trade association that provides standard ratings for movies released to movie theaters. To learn more about the rating system, please visit them at: https://www.mpaa.org.

Redbox On Demand offers thousands of movies, including new releases. If you don't see a new release you want, check to see if it's available on DVD or Blu-ray.

Our agreements with film studios and distributors determine when a film is available to rent or own. Some movies are in their digital-rental window for a limited time only. Often, movies will be available to purchase for a few weeks before they’re available to rent.
If you own the movie or TV show, you can stream on up to five devices simultaneously. If you’ve rented it, you can only stream on one device at a time.

You can register up to five supported devices. The table below lists all supported devices.

Supported Devices

1. LG, Samsung, and VIZIO SmartCast Smart TV
2. Windows or Mac computer
3. Android or iOS mobile or tablet
4. Roku
5. TV via Chromecast
6. Apple TV


Compatable Web Browsers

1. Google Chrome
2. Firefox
3. Internet Explorer*
4. Edge
5. Safari


Recommended Internet Speed

3.0 megabits per second (Mbps)


Silverlight Plugin Required for:

1. IE 11
2. Windows 7
3. Windows 8.1
4. Mac OS older than 10.12 (Sierra)

Download it here: https://www.microsoft.com/silverlight/


For more information on our supported devices, go to https://www.redbox.com/ondemand-howitworks

Movies available at Redbox are rated by the Motion Picture Association of America (MPAA) and the Entertainment Softward Rating Board (ESRB). We require that you acknowledge your age when renting movies with a Restricted (R) with a Mature (M) rating. We do not edit or censor the movies we carry.

We accept the following forms of payment for rentals and purchases:

At the Box

1. Debit Cards
2. Credit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover
3. Redbox Cards
4. MasterPass https://masterpass.com/en-us.html


On Demand

1. Debit Cards
2. Credit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, or Discover


E-Gift Cards and Promo Codes

1. Credit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, or Discover
For assistance renting at a Box, please call 1-866-REDBOX3 (1-866-733-2693). When prompted, press "4." to speak with a representative who can lead you through the rental process.

We currently operate about 41,500 boxes across the U.S. and Puerto Rico.

Find the Box nearest you by visiting https://www.redbox.com/locations or click the GPS icon, commonly located in the lower right corner of your mobile app.

If you're interested in installing a Box in your store or business, please click this link: https://about.redbox.com/request-a-kiosk and complete our application form. Before a box is installed, an analysis of a location's suitability needs to be done. After we receive your application, our team will begin the analysis process.

Our rental fees are charged per night:

DVDs - $1.80
Blu-Ray - $2.00
4K UHD - $2.50

All fees will be clearly displayed during the checkout process. If available, multi-night pricing will be presented during the checkout process if you would like to keep the disc for multiple nights at a discounted rate. Prices are subject to applicable sales tax and may vary by market.

Was this answer helpful?
The MPAA is a trade association that provides standard ratings for movies released to movie theaters. To learn more about the rating system, please visit them at: https://www.mpaa.org.

You can return your disc at any Box location. Its as simple as that!

Find the nearest Box location at: https://www.redbox.com/locations. On your mobile device, in the app, the GPS locator is on the lower right corner of any screen.

Return your disc to any Box location before 9:00 pm the day after you reserve or rent. Returns after 9:00 pm will be subject to another nightly rental fee.

Examples:

I reserve the disc online at 5 pm on Monday.
I pick the disc up from the Box at 8 am on Tuesday.
The disc is due back at 9 pm Tuesday night.
I rent a disc at the Box at 3 pm on Wednesday.
The disc is due back before 9 pm Thursday night.

Redbox On Demand offers thousands of movies, including new releases. If you don't see a new release you want, check to see if it's available on DVD or Blu-ray.

Our agreements with film studios and distributors determine when a film is available to rent or own. Some movies are in their digital-rental window for a limited time only. Often, movies will be available to purchase for a few weeks before they’re available to rent.

Redbox carries DVD and Blu-RayTM  Discs in our Boxes.

We also have a limited supply of 4K Ultra HD Blu-RayTM  Discs avaialble for rent at select locations in Austin, Colorado Springs, Des Moines, Detroit, Kansas City, Los Angeles, Miami, Minneapolis, New York City, Reno, San Diego, San Francisco, Seattle, Spokane and Portland. For more information about 4K UHD availability, go to https://www.redbox.com/4K.

Renting movies at the Box is easy! I At the Box, you can

1. Select Rent Movies
2. Find the movie that you want to rent and select the + sign.
3. Select the Check Out button at the bottom of the screen.
4. Enter your email address to get a receipt.
5. Select the Pay Now button.
6. Swipe/Insert your credit / debit card.
7. Retrieve your movie.

If you want to earn points and rewards or reserve movies before going to the Box, then sign up for an account at https://www.redbox.com/perks. For faster access at the Box, you can use Box Sign In by entering your mobile number & a 4-digit PIN.

There are a few reasons why your disc might not play. The list below offers a few remedies.

1. Clean the disc by wiping the disc from the center outwards using a soft cloth (no paper towels). Clean the disc with a solution of water and mild detergent or rubbing alcohol. Never use abrasives, solvents, or highly acidic cleansers.
2. Ensure that you are playing the correct disc in the correct player with compatible accessories. (For example, playing a Blu-rayTM disc in a Blu-rayTM player with compatabile Blue-rayTM accessories or playing 4K UHD in a 4K UHD player.)
3. Try another disc in the player to verify that the player is not the source of the problem.

If the disc still doesn’t play properly, you can report this thorugh our IVR at 1-866-733-2693 (Option 1) by entering the barcode and your payment information. Return the disc to our Box (before or after reporting this) to prevent additional nightly rental charges.

If your Redbox app isn't launching, try the following:

Mobile Device (Phone/Tablet)

1. Verify that your mobile device is up to date with software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the application.
3. Close the mobile app and try again.
4. Power cycle the device.


Web Browser

1. Verify that your computer is up to date with any available software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the browser (or a supported version).
3. Close the browser and try again.
4. Restart your computer.


Roku or Smart TV

1. Check for available software and firmware upgrades.
2. Restart the device.
3. Re-launch the application.

If this doesn't solve the problem, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

answers.Summary: Charged twice for rental or purchase
answers.Answer:
Multiple charges may be the result of an authorization hold, which financial institutions sometimes take 3-5 days to release. It may also be for a partial payment collection if we were unable to collect the full balance at one time.

For Rentals - For any transaction involving a rental, you will see an immediate authorization for the one-night balance. The authorization is released when the discs are returned, then you are charged for the amount due based on the nights out. The authorization is released immediately, however your financial institution may take 3-5 days to process this. If you still have concerns, please contact Customer Care at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat

For Purchases - If you were billed multiple times for a disc that was purchased, please contact our Customer Care team to review the details of the transaction. Contact Customer Care at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat

For On Demand - If you were billed multiple times for an On Demand Transaction (Rental or Purchase), please contact our Customer Care team to review the details of the transaction. When using On Demand, be careful to complete the transaction only one time and not select Submit multiple times. Visit Customer Care at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat
You can buy a replacement case from any box for the cost of a 1-day DVD rental. Just scroll through the DVD list and look for replacement case at the end.

We'll hold onto your disc until 9 p.m. the day after you reserve it. If you just reserved it today, you've still got time to pick it up. You can check your reservation confirmation email for the address.

You might be able to cancel your reservation if it's still within the rental period and has yet to be picked up. Contact our Care team at 866-733-2693 or https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat.

There are a maximum number of rentals you can have out at a time, even when using separate transactions. Refer to the table below to learn about rental maximums:

First Time Customers

On your first visit to Redbox (or the first time you use a new payment card at Redbox), you can rent a maximum of 3 discs.


Returning Customers

Customers who have rented from Redbox before can rent a maximum of 5 discs.

If you want to use a promo code, you’ll need to have it at the time you’re renting. Here's how:


Using Promo Codes Attached to Your Online Profile

When you're checking out at the Box, online or through the mobile app, choose Apply Promo and select the promo code you want to apply.

Using Promo Codes Sent via Email or SMS

You'll need to have the promo code when you are completing the transaction. During the checkout process, choose Apply Promo to manually enter the promo code.


If you forgot your promo code, you might be able to cancel your reservation as long as it's still within the rental period and has yet to be picked up. Contact our Care team at 866-733-2693 or via chat at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat to learn your options. Once cancelled, you can process the reservation again using the promo code as long as it is still available.

A credit card or debit card is required to rent movies, even if you are using a promo code / Redbox Perks. Your credit / debit card acts like a security deposit for your rental, and it’s on hand for daily charges if you want to hold on to your disc for more than one night.

If you used a promo code or Redbox Perks points to rent the disc, you may see a authorization hold that will drop off within 3-5 days.

We accept the following forms of payment for rentals and purchases:

At the Box

1. Debit Cards
2. Credit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover
3. Redbox Cards
4. MasterPass https://masterpass.com/en-us.html


On Demand

1. Debit Cards
2. Credit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, or Discover


E-Gift Cards and Promo Codes

1. Credit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, or Discover

Want to make sure you get your disc before it rents out? Reserve it online, here's how:


Reserving through the Redbox App

Select Search or Browse to find a title on your Redbox app, then select Rent Now and follow the instructions on the checkout page.


Reserving through Redbox.com

Scroll through the movies at https://www.redbox.com, then select Rent Now. Follow the instructions on the checkout page.


Canceling Your Reservation

If you don’t pick up your reservation, you’ll still be charged for one night's rental because the disc will still be taken out of circulation for other customers that night.

You might be able to cancel your reservation if it's still within the rental period and has yet to be picked up. Contact our Care team at 866-733-2693 or via https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat to learn your options.
